title: [Season 6] Less obvious, but impactful changes

embed.description: Previous PBE Cycles in 2015 Hello and welcome to Patch 5.22, the beginning of . is a time of great change in League of Legends and there will be a lot of information and changes to digest over the course of the cycle.

body:
Aside from all the obvious changes in the preseason that are hot topics in this forum, there are a few subtle, but possibly highly impactful changes that are currently sort-of flying under the radar of Gameplay and Balance.

**The great tenacity nerf**

Zephyr is removed. Merc Treads tenacity is lowered to 20%. This will be highly beneficial to CC-based mages, tanks and supports. And also make champions with kit-intrinsic tenacity more valuable. Hello {{champion:36}} {{champion:39}} .

**Initial spawn timers reduced.**

Games now have 15 seconds less downtime in the beginning. Potentially, less early action?

**Major Tower Buff**

Towers now work more like minions, with no resistances, but increased health pools. The new health values are higher than the raw conversion of the previous eHP into HP with the removal of resistances. E.g. outer towers had 100 res and 1000 HP, now have 3500 HP.

**AP ratio for tower damage increased to 0.5**

AP champions are now slightly better in tower taking potential. With Nashor's, an AP will be able to take a tower almost as fast as an AD.

**Teleport is nerfed**

No longer has reduced cooldown on teleporting to towers. 

**Jungle changes**

Jungle monsters have less XP. Jungle items give bonus XP. Laners will no longer be able to take camps for fast level 2.

**Elixir of Iron buffed**

Now gives 300 HP, too - and Tenacity, which has increased in value.

**Powerspikes**

Especially the gold flow changes, but also the item improvements, will affect the timings and impacts of champion powerspikes. This is the most intangible change, and its effects will not completely revealed unless everyone got used to the changes.

This is a strict buff to them- as I said, nexus and inhibitor structures aren't changing in the least- the changes that you think are happening are actually the exact way they are right now. Towers, however, are changing: they all gain eHP.

Before you suggest a ~68% loss in effective HP, I suggest doing... 1,2,3... Yeah, 3 searches- and that's only if you want to be COMPLETE and check to see that the inhib and nexus are ALREADY what you say they're being 'nerfed' to. Nexus
HP increased to 4000.

Armour and resistance was removed which I won't understand why. Log onto your PBE account and go see how long it takes to take out a tower now, because I can assure you unless people are taking down towers before 10-15minutes. This is a nerf not a buff.

The Nexus and Inhibitors already have no resistances, they have never had resistances. Those number changes are for the Nexus and Inhibitor **Towers**. Notice in the surrenderat20 changes, it's under towers:

 Towers (Underlined in the page, it's pretty clear they mean both of the below changes)
Inner and Outer towers
    HP increased to 3500 from 1000/1300
    Armor/MR reduced to 0 from 100

Nexus and Inhib
    HP increased to 4000 from 1300/1500
    MR /Armor reduced to 0 from 1000



Also on that note, I think the 1000 is a typo, they only have 100 atm.

If I'm not 100% mistaken, those eHP values you are using are for when there are no minions nearby to remove their insane armor/MR buff. With minions nearby their effective HP seems to be approximately the same as before.

Basically backdooring champions are getting a MASSIVE stealth buff, and everybody else won't notice any real difference.
Ah, that makes it much better then.

Actually, based on what the Wiki says, inhib/nexus turrets both have 100 armor/mr base and gain 200 additional armor/mr when there are no nearby enemy lane minions. I don't know where people are getting this whole 1000 armor/mr thing from, but it's never been a part of the game. More likely than anything it was just a typo and they meant to say they removed the base 100 armor/mr (which means the anti-backdoor armor/mr buff may still be in effect).

Backdoor plating is still in effect, and still gives 200 Armor/MR.

It is actually even more efficient now - higher base HP = more eHP.

For example, outer towers used to have 2000 eHP and 4000 eHP. Now they have 3500 eHP and 10500 eHP.

>Teleport is nerfed
No longer has reduced cooldown on teleporting to towers.

Whoa,where does it say that?I haven't seen any TP nerfs pop up on the PBE yet.
Not explicitly mentioned. But if you play a game with TP on PBE and look at its description -> No more reduction. Full 300 seconds for everything.

They really, really nerfed TP by removing the reduced cooldown on towers? This is absolutely the wrong way to nerf TP, the problem with it was that top and mid laners were abusing it to teleport to a minion botlane and get a double, so why the fuck would they increase the cooldowns on towers and not minions? No one teleports to towers in the first place! They couldn't care about their outer turrets falling because it wouldn't have protected them from dives anyway, and sidelane pressure doesn't matter anymore since tower dives are so easy to pull off with your team in other lanes. Champions are still going to abuse it to farm kills botlane because the cooldown is unchanged, all this does is hurt champions like {{champion:75}} who used teleport to actually return to tower and miss less farm early game after being bullied out of lane, toplaners who just abuse early game hard CC to get their ADC a double kill remain unaffected.

And still no buffs to tower damage, honestly tower damage is a joke at this point and no one gets punished for 2v1 diving full health champions and it's part of the reason double TP is so obnoxious, no thought or timing is required in tower diving anymore you can just force it so long as you have a friend there.
To be fair, that's why it was picked up over ignite way back in S4.

I don't have a problem with toplane TP meta, it allows them to return to lane and possibly make a play from a traditionally isolated lane. What ruined the game for me is worlds, which started these obnoxious double and triple TP compositions where if any lane steps a foot over the median, 4 people gang up on them. It forces ultra-passive lanes, which contrary to what you would expect actually hurts late game champions because they contribute nothing to the level 4 5v5 teamfights that happen botlane every 2 minutes, and just makes the game snowbally as hell and more like deathmatch than anything else.

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RzmQkW8A,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-11-01T20:55:54.354+0000)
>all this does is hurt champions like {{champion:75}} who used teleport to miss less farm early game after being bullied out of lane.

This was the issue
if they take teleport, they get play making capabilities while also being unshovable out of lane. You could not "win lane" with the teleport meta since by the time you pushed up to their tower to make them lose minions to punish them for dying, they would already be back and ready to farm.

There is zero incentive to run ignite in solo lanes because of this, since the whole purpose of ignite was to improve lane dominance in exchange for losing global presence with teleport. With teleport also improving lane dominance, summoner spell diversity in these solo lanes has dropped.

The problem with TP right now isn't champions being unshoveable, it's champions who teleport to bot lane and get their ADC fed out of control. The cooldown only on minons needs to be increased because top and midlaners can teleport the moment someone else overextends, they don't have to wait for an opportunity or think about when the best time to teleport is because the cooldown is too low for the power it brings. This creates somewhat of a nuclear weapon dilemma where just the mere possibility of a teleport makes laners too scared to make plays, so it alters how players play the game even without the spell actually being used.

Tower teleports are much more predictable and can be canceled by bringing down the tower, unlike minion teleports which you can't do anything about. There are much better ways to nerf teleport than by removing the CDR on towers.

Unless you remove teleport from the game entirely, the top laner TPing to bot lane to get the adc fed will always happen and no nerf to the CD is going to stop that. Thing is though, people absolutely do TP to towers. They back, buy TP to the tower without losing CS, and then with the CD halved, it's back up in 2 minutes for them to then go bot before they've been shoved out of lane. Now they can still go bot, but they can't also get a quick return to the lane before they do it. Likewise they can't TP to a tower that's got a big wave pushing in the mid-late game and still have it up to make a big play so soon after it.

You forgot to mention that the tank tree (Valor or w/e it's called) has 15% tenacity built into it, which means you'll get 15 right out of the gate. With merc treads it returns to 35%. Less value in a singular item, more value if you're building tank-on-tank.

iirc Tenacity is a multiplicative value and not additive so it is indeed still a nerf compared to live otherwise Irelia and Mundo would reach absurd levels of Tenacity if it was additive (iron pot, mercs, mastery, Mundo W/Irelia Passive would reach near 100% if it were additive).

he is going to be the biggest abuser in my opinion. Champ is too strong as is (that's just my opinion). He has so many eHP + AD options that he does really well with in Sterak's (one of the best users of this item), Hexdrinker, Black Cleaver (this was nerfed on the preseason though) and Frozen Mallet. I feel like he has too many options for offensive items without having to worry heavily on HP + Resists items due to his Passive and his Mega Form. 

Anyway. Gnar's boomerang into AA's plus Frozen Mallet is one of the most painful things to deal with as his W procs chunk and he will be able to stay on you no matter what you do unless you have a teammate or tower nearby to dissuade him from pursuing.

There is so much false info in here, I'm just gonna put it in list format:
-the only item in there that is viable on Gnar is black cleaver
-he isn't even close to a great user of Sterak's
-all dedicated tanks need at least 5 tank items (Gnar is a "dedicated tank")
-black cleaver was changed, not nerfed (it lost 10 ad, 10 armor pen, gained 200 hp, and  gained rage passive)
-you shouldn't be giving people "advice" if you have never played a ranked game

I will say that you have the false info here. I will start by stating that every item that I mentioned as an offensive/semi-offensive option has a situational use on Gnar and that every one of the mentioned items has been used by professional players in competition as stand alone items or in conjunction with more offensive options. Check the games of Zion Spartan, Impact, and Smeb to see what I'm talking about. 

Situational buys on offensive items early help you hold your own in lane and give you a damage boost in midgame teamfights even if you are going to be a main tank of the team. Hexdrinker is one of the best items into a magic damage opponent like Rumble to be able to effectively trade with him. The passive of Hexdrinker will also give a significant shield in the midgame to help you survive that extra few seconds to dish out a little extra damage or get away without giving a kill over to your enemies. 

Another thing to consider is that if you have another main tank on your team (say a Jungler) and your other laners are behind or your comp is lacking in damage overall. Getting an offensive item or two can make you more of a threat to the enemy team and with the items of {{item:3022}} {{item:3155}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3071}}, you aren't taking a massive hit to your overall tankiness, meaning you will still be a pretty good frontliner.

On Sterak's specifically, he is actually a fairly good user of the item right now and I think the item is only good on a handful of champs situationally, but Gnar can use it very well due to having a lot of Total AD scaling on his abilities, his AA's being a very important part of his damage output, and his Mega Form having the highest Base AD of any champion in the game (pretty sure) meaning he gets the most AD out of the item. His passive charges based on how much he outputs damage and how much he takes as well making Sterak's perfect for him. Gaining size and a shield (particularly in Mega Form) will also be very beneficial for his Crowd Control and tanking ability in Mega form. 

On Black Cleaver, I was mentioning the preseason changes that are currently on the PBE for the item. The cost was increased to 3500 and the AD went up to 55 while the HP it gives has gone down to 300, so I felt like it was an overall nerf, at least to Gnar with the item as the cost increase hurts him and he didn't care about the AD as much as the CDR, HP, Rage passive and armor shred. 

Lastly, I wasn't giving people advice like you stated. I was making an observation and stating my opinion on the matter. If people read it and thought on it, maybe they would come to the same conclusion or maybe they would land somewhere else. But I will leave with this. Whether or not someone plays ranked does not really indicate whether or not they have some basic knowledge of the game and can make assumptions based on experience and numbers of items, champions, and abilities about interactions within that game. Rank can be a very good indication on how much you know about the game as you have to know a really good volume of it to achieve higher ranks, but it is not a requirement of someone who has good game knowledge to have a high rank or to even play ranked at all. I personally have played over 2000 games of League. Maybe one day I would decide to try my hand at Ranked but I don't see the point other than to prove to a bunch of people on the boards that I have some idea of what I'm talking about. 

Anyway. That's my rant. Later. Peace.
